prices

protected java.util.Map<Good,java.lang.Double> prices
A simple map which stores calculated prices for goods produced by this firm. Derived classes may ignore these values if, e.g., prices are dynamically calculated.

update

public void update()
Description copied from interface: AsyncUpdate
Commit the changes made to this object to the underlying data structure. For example, if the implementing object is a hash map, it should apply all the changes it has saved and deferred to the backing HashMap.

Specified by:

grantEndowment

public void grantEndowment(double amount)

bankruptcy

public void bankruptcy()
The firm is bankrupt. Clean up!

produces

public boolean produces(Good good)
Parameters:
good -
Returns:
true if the firm (nominally) produces the good, false otherwise. Note that whether the firm produces a non-zero amount depends on the behavior of the specific firm.

getAccounts

public Accounts getAccounts()
Returns:
The accounts associated with this firm.

startProducing

public void startProducing(Good good,
                           ProductionFunction pf)
The firm should start producing the specified good. The good will be listed in the set of goods produced by the firm, but actual (i.e., non-zero) production will depend on the exact behavior of the firm.

Parameters:
good - The good to start producing
pf - The production function for the good

setLastProduction

public void setLastProduction(Good good,
                              double value)
Set the last production. This is used usually at initialization time.

Parameters:
good -
value -

stopProducing

public void stopProducing(Good good)
The firm will stop producing the specified good. It may still retain an inventory and may still sell that remaining inventory.

Parameters:
good - The good to stop producing

getPrice

public double getPrice(Market m,
                       Consumer consumer)
Query the price set by the firm for the specified good to the specified consumer. The default version just uses the stored value and ignores the consumer (i.e., does not price discriminate).

Parameters:
good - Which good
consumer - Which consumer
Returns:
The price
